result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas S. Christman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription AS VERIFIED BY AGENT.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include: sex assault/victimization.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with known felons, drug users or dealers, nor Shenanigans, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Comply w/ Vivitrol Progam and all requirements.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed at descretion of agent.
STAYED.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a conditon of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.
AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION. TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber for employment and treatment.

records.addlTxt: nunc pro tunc back to 4/4/17
180 days conditional time.
And Stipulation to waive appearance and hearing and order for conditional jail time - 180 days
from DOC Agt Adrienne Schofield.
Bond applied; partial refund; jk/jg     ck#16CH076265
To linked case 16-CF-39
of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes and stays a total sentence of 8 1/2 years WSP; 5 years initial confinement, 3 1/2 years extended supervision; deft placed on probation for 4 years w/conditions; 1 year conditional jail stayed, w/Huber upon agent's discretion; no contact with known felons, drug users/dealers, Shenanigan's; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs in this file and in file 16CF39, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson requests to adjourn for reasons set forth on the record.  SEH adjourned to 4/28/16 at 10am.  Bond continued.
Letters of support for deft; filed by Atty K Watson.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 3/24/16 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DDA Graveley states the case was resolved but the deft has new charges pending, will be discussing a global resolution.  FPT continued to 2/12/16 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 1/14/16 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

*No Weapons.  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/ Kevin J G, Greg L C or their residence; any Shenanigans in Kenosha Co.  No pellet or BB type guns or rifles.
943.32(2) Attempt Armed Robbery

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson's motion to modify bond.  Court amends bond to $3,500 cash bond w/same conditions previously set.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson states she believes the bond motion was untimely filed.  BBH continued to 10/30/15 at 8:15am; FPT continued to 12/10/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
to Modify Bail/Bond filed by Atty Kristyne Watson.  (Hearing 10/15/15 at 8:15.)

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Atty K Watson appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  State in victim compliance.  FPT continued to 10/15/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson states she still needs to discuss resolution with DDA Graveley, there is also some evidence from Joint Services that she has been unable to play.  FPT continued to 9/10/15 at 9:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Kristyne Watson. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. DAPT on 7-17-15 @ 1:30pm. Judicial pretrial on 7-30-15 @ 8:30am. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing

Filed by Atty K Watson.

Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  6-18-15 @ 9:15.  $5000 cash bond set with conditions.

*No Weapons.  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/ Kevin J G, Greg L C or their residence; any Shenanigans in Kenosha Co.  No pellet or BB type guns or rifles.
